description.en: The course will cover the legal and international challenges democratic instruments face domestically and internationally, discuss case studies from Estonia and abroad, and analyse scholarly research on these topics.
description.et: Kursus hõlmab õiguslikke ja rahvusvahelisi väljakutseid, millega demokraatlikud instrumendid silmitsi seisavad nii riigisiseselt kui ka rahvusvaheliselt, arutatakse juhtumiuuringuid Eestist ja välismaalt ning analüüsitakse nende teemadega seotud teadusuuringuid.

objectives.en: This course will give an insight into the organization and administration of elections and other democratic instruments such as petitions. The objective will be to understand the complexities of organizing these key events in a democracy, including their observation. The course is focusing also on its electronic derivates, such as the organization of electronic voting, participation, and participatory budgeting, amongst others.
objectives.et: Kursus annab ülevaate valimiste korraldamisest ja haldamisest ning muudest demokraatlikest vahenditest, näiteks petitsioonidest. Eesmärk on mõista nende võtmesündmuste korraldamise keerukust demokraatlikus riigis, sealhulgas nende vaatlemist. Kursus keskendub muu hulgas ka elektroonilistele tuletistele, nagu elektroonilise hääletamise korraldamine, osalemine ja osaluseelarve koostamine.

learning_outcomes.en: The students completing the course will (1) understand and have an overview of the key components and complexities that are involved in organizing elections, (2) be able to analyze the use of a democratic instrument in a given context using international standards, (3) be able to derive (technical) requirements for the implementation of democratic instruments using electronic means, and (4) have a reflective understanding of their own role in such processes whether as participant, candidate, organizer or observer.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbinud üliõpilased (1) mõistavad valimiste korraldamisel osalevaid põhikomponente ja nende ülevaadet ning omavad ülevaadet, (2) oskavad analüüsida demokraatlike vahendite kasutamist antud kontekstis rahvusvaheliste standardite abil, (3) ) olema võimelised tuletama (tehnilisi) nõudeid demokraatlike vahendite rakendamiseks elektrooniliste vahendite abil ja (4) olema reflektiivne arusaam oma rollist sellistes protsessides kas osaleja, kandidaadi, korraldaja või vaatlejana.

independent_work.et:
Analysis of assigned reading materials. In case of questions the instructor will be available after class for further discussion. 

Group Assignment - The students will write a group (2-5 students) essay about a single case study assessing one election. The group assignments need to indicate which individual is responsible for which particular part of the assignment. By that, the Professor will be able to assess the individual contribution of each student. 

Presentation - The groups will present their findings to their colleagues and compare/contrast the results and assessments with each other. 

Exam - The students will have to write an individual test on the basis of the reading materials of the course.

description.et: The presentation will be assessed against presentation skills (5) and coherency and consistency (5).

The exam will consist of three open answer questions which amount to half of the points (5 each, total of 15), and five closed multiple choice questions amounting to the other half of the points (3 each, total of 15).

The group assignment will be assessed against relevance (10%) use of theory (10%), methodology (10%), data collection (10%), analysis (10%), formal criteria (citation, formatting, 10%). This will contribute to achieving learning outcome 5.

grade_preconditions.et: Active participation on the classes is the prerequisite for final assessment. Missing more than three classes without a valid excuse results in not being admitted to grading. All assignments has to be submitted and/or performed due time.

grade_evaluation.et:
Group essay submitted due deadline (60% of the final grade), its presentation (10% of the final grade) and exam (30% of the final grade).  
A - 91-100 points
B - 81-90 points
C - 71-80 points
D - 61-70 points
E - 51-60 points
F - <=50

debt_elimination.et:
As agreed with instructors. 
The lecturer and teaching assistants will be available for questions via email. Personal meetings can be agreed as well, ideally after class.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
